cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles NNE of San Juan, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving northwest and forecast to recurve over the western Atlantic, passing well north of the Virgin Islands and then turning north toward Bermuda
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just west of Bermuda

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, including the Virgin Islands and Puerto Rico, experiencing rain bands and swell
weather_observation.wind: Outer rain bands could bring brief tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) to St. Croix on Saturday.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches with isolated 3 inch totals possible, producing localized flash-flood potential.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Building seas and rip currents from long-period swells generated by Jerry.
